definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: An elephant can uproot a tree or pick a flower without bruising a petal.
sentences.chinese: 大象能够拔起大树，或者摘下小花而不损伤花瓣。

sentences.english: The elephants paint pictures in Elephant Show at Nongnooch Tropical Garden.
sentences.chinese: 泰国芭达雅东芭乐园的大象表演画图。

sentences.english: How do you keep a pachyderm out of your garden?
sentences.chinese: 怎样才能让大象远离你家的花园？

sentences.english: Daisy turned around and found that she was being watched by an elephant.
sentences.chinese: 戴茜转过身去，看到一头大象正在望着她。

sentences.english: The tower was mounted on the backs of "four well-trained elephants.
sentences.chinese: 这个塔搭建在四个训练有素的大象背上。

sentences.english: You can imagine using this to butcher an elephant, to cut the hide and remove the meat.
sentences.chinese: 你可以想象一下用它来屠宰一头大象，扒皮卸肉。

sentences.english: This elephant is five times weightier than that small tiger.
sentences.chinese: 这头大象比那只小老虎重五倍。

sentences.english: Scientists have noted that elephants tend to avoid trees with beehives.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们指出大象往往避开有蜂房的树木。

sentences.english: The aggressive elephants are simply defending their territories, apparently.
sentences.chinese: 很显然，这些大象只是在保卫自己的领土而已。

sentences.english: It was a picture of a boa constrictor digesting an elephant.
sentences.chinese: 仍是一幅大象正在大蟒蛇肚子里消化的画。

sentences.english: An elephant hulked up suddenly before us.
sentences.chinese: 突然一头大象赫然出现在我们的面前。

sentences.english: Elephants are too big to run.
Lose the elephant leg, the first thing to do is, often a bath.
sentences.chinese: 要减掉大象腿，首先要做的就是，勤洗澡。

sentences.english: She has a Chinese-Singaporean mother and a Thai father.
sentences.chinese: 大象是泰国人文化和生活的一个重要部分。

sentences.english: When Horton the elephant heard a small noise.
sentences.chinese: 这时大象霍顿听到了微弱的声音。

definition: Leo (star sign)/Shihtzu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
